results.title: Helping our boys help themselves
results.brief_description: One of the most hotly debated subjects in educational circles worldwide is the trouble many boys are having with traditional schooling and growing up in general. This program provides some practical and desperately needed examples of how two diverse secondary schools are helping their boys to help themselves. Boort Secondary College, a small, country Victorian school where the academic performance and social growth of boys is encouraged through the Building blokes program. Cleeleand Secondary College, a large, tough school in a disadvantaged and multicultural outer Melbourne suburb which helps its boys with the Gateway Project and Make a difference program. An excellent follow up program to “The Trouble with boys”. Study guide included.

results.title: Helping learners to learn
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board, Francis Gysin and Nestor Lovera
results.brief_description: A modern conception of training as a process of attaining objectives. The use of “feedback” from tests enables instructors to modify their courses and to adapt their methods to reach the objectives set. Training is presented as a precisely designed instrument for attaining precisely defined ends. Intended for instructors in the coal industry.

results.title: Helpful Henry
results.brief_description: City boy spends summer on a farm and seems to think they should change their way of living. He has his own ideas about how things work, but eventually finds he is wrong and needs to learn from others.

results.title: Helpers: personalising the instruction of reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Veriation Films, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.), Louise Henry and David Espar
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of supportive personnel in individualising instruction and meeting the needs of students. Illustrates the process used to prepare teachers to work with volunteers, and the professional relationship which exists between the principal, teachers and volunteers.

results.title: Helpem Mifala: aid for Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Australian Agency for International Development, Don Murray and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s aid scheme to the Solomon Islands which became independent in 1978. As well as financial aid, technical and medical advisors are assisting the Islands in their development. Photographer - Dean Semler; editor - Sue Horsley; sound - Bob Hayes.

results.title: Help! with the Beatles
results.creator_credit: Walter Shenson Films, Subafilms, Walter Shenson and Richard Lester
results.brief_description: Help! with The Beatles is an example of the evolution of the MTV pop video generation. The film’s plot revolves around a strange sacrificial ring which mysteriously finds its way onto Ringo’s finger. He can’t get the ring off and a group of Indian mystics (led by Leo McKern) start to stalk the Beatles in their attempts to get the ring back. The plot scenarios are pretty silly, although it’s fun to see the quintessentially sixties decor and clothes. The main attraction to “Help!” is of course the Beatles’ songs which play like pop videos. Included in the film are; “Help!”, “You’ve Got to Hide Your Love Away”, “Ticket to Ride”, “Another Girl”, “I Need You” and “The Night Before”.

results.title: Help yourself to better health
results.creator_credit: Jamil Simon Productions and Jamil Simon
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how good nutrition is possible with limited budgets, varying food habits, and different cooking facilities. A trip through a supermarket with an older person demonstrates how older people can shop wisely and nutritionally.

results.title: Help yourself to a better back
results.brief_description: This tape offers a brief but fairly comprehensive introduction to safe workplace practice and back care in both office and industrial settings. For office workers the main cause of back injury is sitting for long periods, without breaks and without varying the pose of the body. This video suggests a series of simple exercises that take just a couple of minutes, and can be performed at the desk or in a restricted area. For workers in industry the main risk is lifting. The video provides a simple and easy to follow checklist of things to remember when lifting. It also provides details of good lifting and carrying techniques.

results.title: Help yourself - self employment (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Self-employed people describe their work and explain why they are self employed. Their occupations vary from handyman, stallholders, to a proprietor of a chain of jeans stores. All of these businesses started with relatively small amounts of capital. The video also outlines essential steps to be taken by people considering self-employment and lists contacts who can give useful advice.

results.title: Help wanted: secretary
results.brief_description: A good secretary requires a state of mind that goes beyond the basic secretarial skills. Three situations in which bad secretarial practices are demonstrated are seen and are followed by a short restatement of the desired qualities of a good secretary.
